alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 2:59PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Boundary, Bonner, northwestern Shoshone, northeastern Benewah, eastern Kootenai and east central Pend Oreille Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 158 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Priest River to 7 miles north of Fourth Of July Pass to near St. Maries. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sandpoint, St. Maries, Kellogg, Priest River, Pinehurst, Spirit Lake, Ponderay, Athol, Kootenai, Smelterville, Dover, Clark Fork, East Hope, Wardner, Fourth Of July Pass, Oldtown, Hope, Jordan Creek Campground, Schweitzer Mountain, and Cocolalla. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Idaho between mile markers 22 and 53. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 440 and 494. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 1 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle
